metadata.title: Ellie
metadata.writer: Aaron Sorkin, Kevin Falls & Laura Glasser

special_features: Commentary by Aaron Sorkin on select episodes

notes: This episode highlights the strained relationship between President Bartlet and his daughter Ellie.
The subplot regarding the Surgeon General reflects the political climate of the early 2000s.

real_world_cultural_references: Contemporary political issues regarding drug decriminalization.

continuity_notes: Continues the storyline of the Bartlet administration's handling of controversial figures.

plot.plot_summary: As President Bartlet returns from a trade summit in Tokyo, he faces backlash over comments made by Surgeon General Griffith advocating for marijuana decriminalization. Tensions escalate when his daughter Ellie publicly expresses confidence in Griffith's job security, prompting awkward family dynamics. The episode navigates the administration's public relations challenges and the President's evolving relationship with Ellie.
